> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/willmcgugan/rich/pull/327?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [33a171d...4025348](https://codecov.io/gh/willmcgugan/rich/pull/327?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

I suspect that would still blow up elsewhere in the api.

The magic that `addict` is doing is going to break any kind of introspection. Could you just convert it to a dict with `dict(data)`?
Yes converting to dict works fine. I know this library makes a lot of things difficult and when I am not in the REPL I am totally fine with casting it to dict
It's unfortunate, but I don't think I should merge this one. I think the way `addict` reports that all attributes exist, is an anti-pattern if not a bug.
I totally understand. Thanks for your time and great work
